titleInfo.title: Four Gospels of the Lord Jesus Christ according to the Authorized version of King James I

originInfo.publisher: Waltham Saint Lawrence, Berkshire: Golden Cockerel Press

mods.abstract: One of the most beautiful books printed in the 20th century is Eric Gill's edition of the Four Gospels. Printed at the Golden Cockerel Press in 1931, Gill's work was issued in an edition of 500 copies. Gill (1882-1940) was a philosopher, sculptor, and type designer, whose beautiful Perpetua type is frequently used today. His skill in matching and interweaving type with illustration was at its peak in the Four Gospels.
mods.note: According to the Authorized version of King James I

copyInformation.subLocation: LSU Special Collections: Rare Book Collection

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained in accordance with U. S. copyright laws.
mods.note: LSU Special Collections Online, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
